concepts.name: User Authentication
concepts.description: A system that verifies users' identities to ensure only authorized access to web applications.

concepts.name: Machine Learning
concepts.description: A type of artificial intelligence where computers improve their performance by learning from data.

concepts.name: Responsive Design
concepts.description: Web design approach that ensures a site looks good on all devices by adjusting layout and content based on screen size.

concepts.name: Serverless Computing
concepts.description: A cloud computing model where developers build and run applications without managing server infrastructure.

concepts.name: Version Control
concepts.description: A system that tracks changes to code over time, allowing developers to collaborate and manage code history.

concepts.name: API Integration
concepts.description: Connecting different software systems using APIs to enable them to communicate and share data.

concepts.name: Front-End Frameworks
concepts.description: Libraries or frameworks that simplify building user interfaces, like React, Angular, or Vue.js.

concepts.name: Web Security
concepts.description: Practices and tools used to protect websites from attacks, data breaches, and other security threats.

concepts.name: Augmented Reality
concepts.description: Technology that overlays digital information on the real world through devices like smartphones or AR glasses.

concepts.name: Progressive Web Apps
concepts.description: Web applications that offer an app-like experience on the web, including offline access and push notifications.

concepts.name: SOLID Principles
concepts.description: A set of five design principles for writing maintainable and scalable object-oriented code.

concepts.name: package.json
concepts.description: A file used in Node.js projects to manage project dependencies, scripts, and metadata.

concepts.name: package-lock.json
concepts.description: A file that locks the versions of dependencies in a Node.js project to ensure consistent installations across environments.

concepts.name: Node.js
concepts.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for building scalable network applications.

concepts.name: Next.js
concepts.description: A React framework that enables server-side rendering and static site generation for improved performance and SEO.

concepts.name: Webpack
concepts.description: A module bundler for JavaScript applications that bundles and optimizes code and assets for the web.

concepts.name: Docker
concepts.description: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications inside lightweight, portable containers.

concepts.name: CI/CD
concepts.description: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment, practices that automate code integration, testing, and deployment.

concepts.name: MERN Stack
concepts.description: A stack of technologies for building web applications, including MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js.

concepts.name: RESTful API
concepts.description: An API design style that uses HTTP requests to perform CRUD operations, leveraging standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE.

concepts.name: GraphQL
concepts.description: A query language for APIs that allows clients to request only the data they need, and nothing more.

concepts.name: OAuth
concepts.description: An open standard for access delegation, commonly used for token-based authentication and authorization.

concepts.name: Microservices
concepts.description: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled services, each responsible for a specific functionality.

concepts.name: HTML
concepts.description: The standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications.

concepts.name: CSS
concepts.description: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML.

concepts.name: JavaScript
concepts.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language that is a core technology of the World Wide Web.

concepts.name: Web Accessibility
concepts.description: The practice of ensuring that websites and web applications are usable by people with disabilities.

concepts.name: SEO
concepts.description: Search Engine Optimization: The practice of increasing the quantity and quality of traffic to your website through organic search engine results.

concepts.name: Express.js
concepts.description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

concepts.name: SQL
concepts.description: Structured Query Language: A domain-specific language used for managing data held in a relational database management system.

concepts.name: NoSQL Databases
concepts.description: A type of database that provides a mechanism for storage and retrieval of data modeled in means other than the tabular relations used in relational databases.

concepts.name: ORM
concepts.description: Object-Relational Mapping: A programming technique for converting data between incompatible type systems using object-oriented programming languages.

concepts.name: Git
concepts.description: A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.

concepts.name: HTTPS
concepts.description: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure: An extension of the HTTP protocol that uses SSL/TLS for secure communication over a computer network.

concepts.name: Cross-Site Scripting Prevention
concepts.description: Security measures to prevent malicious scripts from being injected into web pages viewed by other users.

concepts.name: Data Structures
concepts.description: Ways of organizing and storing data for efficient access and modification (e.g., arrays, linked lists, trees, graphs).

concepts.name: Algorithms
concepts.description: Step-by-step procedures for solving problems or performing tasks (e.g., sorting, searching, pathfinding).

concepts.name: Big O Notation
concepts.description: A mathematical notation that describes the limiting behavior of a function when the argument tends towards a particular value or infinity.

concepts.name: Object-Oriented Programming
concepts.description: A programming paradigm based on the concept of 'objects', which can contain data and code.

concepts.name: Functional Programming
concepts.description: A programming paradigm that treats computation as the evaluation of mathematical functions and avoids changing state and mutable data.

concepts.name: Blockchain
concepts.description: A decentralized, distributed ledger technology that records transactions across many computers.
